overview: Constant Attendance Allowance can help if you need daily care and attention because of a disability, and claim certain benefits such as Industrial Injuries Disablement Benefit
title: Constant Attendance Allowance

table.body: If you claim [Industrial Injuries Disablement Benefit](/industrial-injuries-disablement-benefit "Industrial Injuries Disablement Benefit") or a [War Disablement Pension](/war-disablement-pension "War Disablement Pension"), and you need daily care and attention because of a disability, you can claim Constant Attendance Allowance.
table.title: Overview

table.body:
You'll get Constant Attendance Allowance at 4 different rates, depending on the extent of your disability and the amount of care you need:

|Rate| Weekly amount|
|Exceptional rate|£120.40|
|Intermediate rate|£90.30|
|Full day rate|£60.20|
|Part day rate|£30.10|

If you get the 'exceptional rate' or 'intermediate rate', you may also be able to get Exceptionally Severe Disablement Allowance. You can contact the [Service Personnel and Veterans Agency](http://www.veterans-uk.info/about_us/about_us.html "Service Personnel and Veterans Agency"){:rel="external"} or your local [Jobcentre Plus office](http://los.direct.gov.uk/default.aspx?type=1&lang=en "Jobcentre Plus office"){:rel="external"} for advice. 

For general advice contact the Benefit Enquiry Line.

$C**Benefit Enquiry Line**

**Telephone:** 0800 88 22 00  
**Textphone:** 0800 24 33 55

Monday to Friday, 8.30am to 6.30pm$C

**How Constant Attendance Allowance is paid**

All benefits, pensions and allowances are paid into an account, eg your bank account.
table.title: What you'll get

table.body:
You must be claiming one of the following:

- [Industrial Injuries Disablement Benefit](/industrial-injuries-disablement-benefit "Industrial Injuries Disablement Benefit")
- [War Disablement Pension](/war-disablement-pension "War Disablement Pension")

**If you're claiming Industrial Injuries Disablement Benefit**

To claim you must:

- need daily care and attention (for example, home nursing or home meals) 
- be 100% disabled (according to a medical examination) 

You can contact your local [Jobcentre Plus office](http://los.direct.gov.uk/default.aspx?type=1&lang=en "Jobcentre Plus office"){:rel="external"} to find out whether you can get Constant Attendance Allowance.

**If you're getting a War Disablement Pension**

To claim you must:

- need personal help for the same reasons that you get a war pension 
- be getting a war pension of 80% or more 

Contact the Service Personnel and Veterans helpline to find out if you can claim Constant Attendance Allowance.

$C**Service Personnel and Veterans Agency's UK helpline**

**Telephone:** 0800 169 2277  
**If you live overseas:** + 44 1 253 866043  
**Textphone:** 0800 169 3458   
 
Monday to Thursday, 8:15am to 5:15pm  
Friday, 8:15am to 4:30pm $C

You can also contact the Service Personnel and Veterans Agency by e-mail: <veterans.help@spva.gsi.gov.uk>
table.title: Eligibility

table.body:
**For industrial injury cases**

To claim for industrial injury cases you can: 

- ask your local [Jobcentre Plus office](http://los.direct.gov.uk/default.aspx?type=1&lang=en "Jobcentre Plus office"){:rel="external"} to send you a claim form BI104.
- download the claim form

$D[Download 'Constant Attendance Allowance claim form' Bl104 (PDF, 194KB)](http://www.dwp.gov.uk/advisers/claimforms/bi104_print.pdf "'Constant Attendance Allowance claim form' Bl104")$D

**For war pension cases**

To claim for war pension cases, phone the Service Personnel and Veterans Agency and ask for a claim form (WPA 0003 (CAA).

$C**Service Personnel and Veterans Agency's UK helpline**

**Telephone:** 0800 169 2277  
**If you live overseas:**+ 44 1 253 866043  
**Textphone:** 0800 169 3458   

Monday to Thursday, 8:15am to 5:15pm  
Friday, 8:15am to 4:30pm $C

You can also contact the Service Personnel and Veterans Agency by e-mail: <veterans.help@spva.gsi.gov.uk>
table.title: How to claim

table.body:
**What to do if your circumstances change**

You should tell your local [Jobcentre Plus office](http://los.direct.gov.uk/default.aspx?type=1&lang=en "Jobcentre Plus office"){:rel="external"} or the Service Personnel and Veterans Agency if your circumstances change. You can find contact details for the Service Personnel and Veterans Agency in the ['How to claim section'](/constant-attendance-allowance#how-to-claim "How to claim section").

A change of circumstances could be:

- you go into or come out of hospital 
- you enter or leave a nursing home or residential care 
- your spouse goes into hospital (if you get extra money for them) 
- you leave the UK to live abroad permanently 

**Disputes and appeals**

If you're refused Constant Attendance Allowance and you want to know more about the decision or you think it is wrong, contact [Jobcentre Plus office](http://los.direct.gov.uk/default.aspx?type=1&lang=en "Jobcentre Plus office"){:rel="external"} within 1 month of the date of the decision letter.

You can:

- ask for an explanation 
- ask for a written statement of the reasons for the decision 
- ask Jobcentre Plus to look again at the decision to see if it can be changed, there may be some facts you think they have overlooked or you may have more information which affects the decision 
- appeal against the decision to an independent tribunal - this must be in writing 

For more information download 'If you think our decision is wrong leaflet GL24' from the Department for Work and Pensions website.

$D[Download 'If you think our decision is wrong leaflet GL24' (PDF, 500KB)](http://www.dwp.gov.uk/docs/gl24dwp.pdf "'If you think our decision is wrong leaflet GL24'"){:rel="external"}$D
